thread.title: Broadcom vs. Qualcomm, Explained

author: wsjcom
title: Broadcom vs. Qualcomm, Explained
text:
The U.S. government asked Qualcomm Inc. to delay its highly anticipated shareholder vote, slated for Tuesday, for 30 days. The vote was supposed to determine whether Singapore-based Broadcom Ltd. would advance its hostile $117 billion takeover fight for the San Diego chip maker.
The move is a highly unusual intervention by Washington, and it effectively puts on hold Broadcomâ€™s efforts to force Qualcomm to make a deal. Broadcom had nominated a slate of directors supportive of the tie-up. If it had won the shareholder vote,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
